senses.de: Notice or understand the difference between two things or people
senses.ex: She could distinguish the difference between the two types of wine.

Tips.title: Not Always Visual
Tips.description: Distinguishing can involve senses other than sight, like taste or hearing.
Tips.example: He could distinguish the song by its unique guitar riff.

Tips.title: Subtle Differences
Tips.description: Sometimes the differences you distinguish are not obvious, but very slight.
Tips.example: An expert could distinguish the painting as a forgery by the brushstrokes.

Tips.title: Context Clues
Tips.description: Context, like specific details or background info, helps to distinguish meaning.
Tips.example: With the context of the story, she could distinguish the author's intent.

senses.de: Making someone or something special, noticeable or different
senses.ex: She distinguished herself by her outstanding performance in the exams.

Tips.title: Personal Achievements
Tips.description: People often distinguish themselves through talent or hard work, not luck.
Tips.example: He distinguished himself from his peers with his dedication.

Tips.title: Positive Connotation
Tips.description: Distinguishing usually suggests something positive or admirable.
Tips.example: Her innovative approach distinguished her project.

senses.ex: It was hard to distinguish one twin from the other.

Tips.title: Equal Treatment
Tips.description: When distinguishing, it implies fairness by recognizing differences.
Tips.example: The judge distinguished between the two cases fairly.

Tips.title: Clarity in Comparison
Tips.description: Distinguishing helps clarify by comparing and contrasting features.
Tips.example: She distinguished her response to make her point clear.

senses.de: See, hear, or understand something with difficulty
senses.ex: In the darkness, I was barely able to distinguish the shape of a man.

Tips.title: Effort Needed
Tips.description: Sometimes you need to try hard to distinguish something, like in poor conditions.
Tips.example: In the foggy weather, he could barely distinguish the path.

Tips.title: Not Always Certain
Tips.description: Distinguishing can involve uncertainty; you're not always 100% sure.
Tips.example: From the distance, she could only just distinguish the flag's color.

Categorize.wordDefinition:
Categorize means to group things or objects based on similarities or characteristics. For example, you can categorize books as fiction or non-fiction, or you can categorize animals as mammals, reptiles, or birds.

Categorize is applicable when you want to group objects based on similarities or characteristics, while distinguish is applicable when you want to recognize or identify the differences between two or more objects.

Classify.wordDefinition:
Classify means to put things into groups or categories based on their similarities or properties. For example, you can classify books based on their genres or classify animals based on their habitats.

Both words can be used in various contexts, but classify is more applicable when we want to organize or group things, while distinguish is more applicable when we want to recognize or identify differences.

Delineate.wordDefinition:
Delineate means to describe or show something in detail, whereas the word distinguish means to recognize the differences between two or more things.

For example, if you were asked to delineate the features of a character in a book, you would describe their appearance, personality, and behavior in detail.

However, the word delineate is used more when you need to describe or explain something in detail, while distinguish is used more when you need to compare or differentiate between two or more things.

Differentiate.wordDefinition:
Differentiate means to recognize the differences between two or more things that may seem similar. For example, you can differentiate between a lemon and a lime by their color and taste.

Both words involve recognizing differences, but differentiate is used when two or more things need to be identified and separated based on their specific characteristics, while distinguish is used when an individual needs to be recognized based on their unique traits.

Discriminate.wordDefinition:
Discriminate means to unfairly treat or judge someone based on things like race, gender, or religion.

To put it simply, discriminating is bad because it involves treating someone unfairly. Distinguishing is neutral and can be either good or bad depending on the situation.

Identify.wordDefinition:
Identify means to recognize or name something or someone. For example, if you are able to identify a bird, you can name the species.

In simpler terms, distinguishing is about telling apart things that are similar, while identifying is about recognizing or naming something.

Recognize.wordDefinition:
The main difference between distinguish and recognize is that distinguish means to notice differences or distinctions between things, while recognize means to identify something or someone as familiar or known.

If you see a friend across the street, you might immediately recognize them based on their appearance.

Distinguish is often used when trying to separate things that are similar, while recognize is used when trying to identify something that is already known or familiar.

Separate.wordDefinition:
Separate means to divide or split something into two or more distinct parts, or to keep something apart from something else.

For example, we might separate different types of recycling in order to properly dispose of them or we might separate ourselves from people or things that are causing us harm.

Distinguish is used when we want to identify differences or unique qualities between two or more things, while separate is used when we want to divide or split something into distinct parts or keep something apart from something else.

quotes.Text: The first step is to distinguish the loving parts of your personality that are active from the frightened parts of your personality that are active - in other words, to learn to distinguish love from fear in you. The second step is to choose love, no matter what.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Gary Zukav

quotes.Text: I further value this gift as it gave me an opportunity to accept this distinguished honor in a country so devoted to this cause and whose history marks a wonderful chapter in world development.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Frank B. Kellogg

quotes.Text: You just have to find that thing that's special about you that distinguishes you from all the others, and through true talent, hard work, and passion, anything can happen.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Dr. Dre

quotes.Text: Every man's life ends the same way. It is only the details of how he lived and how he died that distinguish one man from another.
quotes.Title: American Novelist
quotes.Name: Ernest Hemingway

quotes.Text: Wise leaders generally have wise counselors because it takes a wise person themselves to distinguish them.
quotes.Title: Greek Philosopher
quotes.Name: Diogenes

quotes.Text: It's very important to be able to distinguish the actors from the characters they play.
quotes.Title: Canadian Actress
quotes.Name: Emily VanCamp

quotes.Text: Sometimes a noble failure serves the world as faithfully as a distinguished success.
quotes.Title: Irish Critic
quotes.Name: Edward Dowden

quotes.Text: The distinguishing characteristic of the techno-thriller is technical detail.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Edward M. Lerner

quotes.Text: Without feelings of respect, what is there to distinguish men from beasts?
quotes.Title: Chinese Philosopher
quotes.Name: Confucius

quotes.Text: I try to distinguish my characters from each other.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Lucy Liu
